title.narrative: Facilitating the safe return of Internally Displaced Persons and Refugees

description.narrative: 1,350 targeted households will have greater food security and resilience to shock after receiving livelihoods and/or home gardening inputs
27 VDCs will build funds through their income generating ventures, enabling them to become durable community-led mechanisms for participatory development
27 villages receiving water infrastructure will have improved access to more reliable, safe sources of water

This project strengthens livelihoods, food and water supply through community-led structures and to ensure an environment conducive to the return of internally displaced persons (IDPs) and refugees in 27 villages in Kayin State. These villages have been selected due to a high presence of refugees and the increased numbers of returning IDPs. This project is part of a broader 4-year programme that will establish inclusive Village Development Committees (VDCs) in a total of 80 villages and support them to prioritise and address a range of needs within each community.

participating-org.narrative: Golden Plain Livelihood Development Services, Myan

mailing-address.narrative: Tavis House, 1-6 Tavistock Square, London WC1H 9NA
